AdditionalFields.Value: Prevention / Early Detection / Interception,Global Health,Cancer Disparities

Description: This session will describe rates of cancer screening for major cancers before onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, during the initial phases of the pandemic, and show the latest available cancer screening rates since the pandemic and surge phases of COVID-19. The session will describe the short-term and long-term effects of changes in screening rates as a result of the pandemic and describe mitigating factors to address any shortfalls in screening among the major cancers as a result of the pandemic. The session will also highlight racial and ethnic disparities that occurred before the pandemic and how the pandemic and any recovery of cancer screening rates post-pandemic might be different for racial and ethnic groups. With any continue disparities for cancer screening post pandemic, mitigation approaches will be discussed.
SearchResultBody: APS02. Progress Since COVID-19 on Cancer Prevention Rates
Title: Progress Since COVID-19 on Cancer Prevention Rates
